titleInfo.title: 'File 34/3 (4/15) Training of Arab pupils from Kuwait in the Bahrain Technical School'

physicalDescription.extent: File is arranged in chronological order, from earliest at beginning of the file to most recent at end.

Condition: The file was previously bound with treasury tags but these have since been removed and its pages are now loose.Foliation: The file's foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, and can be found in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. Circled index numbers written using blue/red crayon can be found throughout the file. The file contains the following foliation errors: 1, 1A, and 1B.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials regarding the entrance of Kuwaiti students to the Bahrain Technical School on scholarships given by the Kuwait Oil Company.Much of the correspondence is with Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, adviser to the ruler of Bahrain, Shaikh Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa (and his successor, Shaikh Salman bin Hamad Al Khalifa). The correspondence discusses the nature of the training given at the school, the expenses involved, the living conditions of the Kuwaiti students and their educational progress.
